intro: Helicteres integrifolia subsp. integrifolia, commonly known as the smoothleaf sycamore, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves with smooth margins. The plant produces showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release tiny seeds when mature. The species is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
